intro: Brongniartia guerrerensis, commonly known as the Guerrero brongniartia, is a rare and endangered plant species native to the tropical rainforests of southern Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its woody stem and large, palmate leaves. The plant produces striking yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators. Due to habitat loss and deforestation, it is critically threatened with extinction in the wild. Conservation efforts are ongoing to protect and propagate this unique botanical species.
